content: nepal mitts by kristina tyla nepal mitts is simple and enough quick to knit project it was designed as one size but thanks to broken rib stitch mitts are enough stretchy and could fit larger hands you can knit them one by one or two-at-a- time with circular needles using magic loop method skill level intermediate skills knit purl 1 stitch left/right leaning cable knit in round it is recommended to utilize the cable without a cable needle method for quicker results sizes one size adult finished measurments approximately 23 cm 9 inches tall lying flat materials ● drops nepal 65% wool 35% alpaca in color medium grey mix 0517 approximately 1 and a half skeins or any aran/worsted yarn to meet the gauge ● 1 set of 4 mm us6 circular needle 61cm 24 inches or longer ● stitch markers ● scrap yarn ● tapestry needle gauge 17 stitches in 10 cm 4 inches in stockinette stitch designers gauge abbreviations k knit p purl m1 make one your preferred method 1/1 lc -
